text: - Hello and welcome to Community Chats.
I'm your host Aley Hammer

and today we're joined
with Karen O'Driscoll,

the group executive for digital
services over at Ventia.
Karen, welcome to the show.
Can you start by telling our audience
a little bit about Ventia?
- Sure. Thanks, Aley.
Ventia is one of the largest
essential service providers in Australia.

We've got a workforce
of about 30,000 people
and over 100 clients
and we work across a number of industries,

including defense and
social infrastructure,
transportation, infrastructure services,
and telecommunications.

I guess the best way to
describe what Ventia does is
to think about your everyday life
and where you may come across Ventia.
If you're driving on a motorway
or in a tunnel and you have an accident
or you run out fuel, Ventia will come

and take you your car away
and take you to safety.
The water and power that you use at home,
often Ventia is behind the scenes

maintaining and operating
the plant and equipment
that provides that water and power.
When you visit

buildings in many
locations across Australia,
Ventia are often managing those buildings,
the facilities, the leases,
the maintenance of those buildings.

So we manage a lot of federal
and state government buildings
across Australia and New Zealand.

Given the increasing
investment in infrastructure
across Australia and New Zealand,

the services we've provide
and the talent that we have,

Ventia is positioned for
a huge growth trajectory.
It's very exciting times for us.

- Well, Ventia has such
a wide impact on people

and communities across
Australia and New Zealand.
And Karen, is there a project

or achievement that you
are specifically proud of,

where Cloud services really
changed the experience

for all the communities
that Ventia actually serves?
- Sure, Aley.

I mean, our Cloud based
enterprise platforms
are a real advantage for Ventia

and there's many examples of
the real value these provide.

I'll take you through a couple
that I'm really proud of.

Our systems enable us to
mobilize very quickly.
And this is really beneficial when they're

unexpected requirements
or urgent requirements
from our clients.
A good example of this was standing up

quarantine services for
Australians returning

from overseas at the
beginning of the pandemic.

We were able to establish
these services over a weekend.

We're also being able to expand
our IOT services in health,
and that allowed Austin Health

to keep operating theatres
running during COVID times

to ensure that the air quality
was continually monitored.

Finally, during the
floods in New South Wales,

we needed to expand our social
housing call center to deal

with the thousands of urgent
calls that were coming in.

We were able to cancel all
of our corporate meetings

and move many of our employees
to focus on this crisis.

And they were able to use
our Cloud based solutions
to take calls and to inspect properties
and record information in the field.

We couldn't have done
this without our standard
and Cloud based systems.
They were easily accessed by our employees

and immediately available
for a wide range of people.

- Well, there were so
many great examples there.
Thank you so much for sharing.

And Karen, when you began
your career many years ago,

did you ever imagine that you
would have a leadership role
in an organization like Ventia?
- Well, I've always enjoyed work,

and particularly industries
with tangible outcomes

and services where you
can really see the impact

of your work and that it has
a positive impact on people
and communities.

And I always admired people
leading digital strategies,
but I guess I didn't dare to dream
that I could have that privilege one day.
Initially when I studied computer science,
I couldn't even get my animated fish
to swim across the screen.
So my digital dreams nearly ended there.
Ventia was the perfect choice for me,
combining my digital drive and passion

in an inclusive culture to
improve the lives of people

and all in Australia, you
know, my backpacking heaven.

And it was clearly a
winning combination for me.
As I've grown in my career at Ventia
and the organization's grown as well,

I've been able to develop
my leadership skills

and I'm really pleased
to have been supported

in a very authentic, to do
so in a very authentic way.
I'm really proud to have the opportunity
to lead the digital agenda here.
It's such a large, diverse organization

and I really enjoy the
fact that I can lead

with inclusivity and
diversity front of mind.

- Absolutely, I mean, speaking
of inclusion and diversity,

how do you build
inclusion within your team
and ensure all the voices are heard?

Because, you know, a
lot of organizations are

chattering a lot around
inclusion and diversity,

but how do you actually
implement it within your teams?
- Sure, some of the things we do,

so we have a very open structure,
which is not hierarchical.
So there are no difficult sort of ranks

to navigate in terms of
conversations or meetings.
The doors are always open
and that goes throughout the organization.
We like mixing up project teams
and giving people the opportunity

to contribute in a different
area that may not be the area
that they commonly work in.

Also driving a digital ecosystem
across the organization,
really allowing people to be part
of our data analytics academy
and our digital think tank.
Engaging people in that digital agenda
really brings some great thinking out
from people across the organization

that may not sit in digital,
but really can contribute
and be part of that.

And their voice is really
important and we want to hear it.

I'm also really passionate
about neurodiversity inclusion.

We have a wonderful son
on the autism spectrum,

and I guess with only
15% of working adults
in full time employment

this is something we're
committed to changing.
Ventia works with a fantastic organization
called Australian Spatial Analytics.
And they've been amazing for us.

They deliver high quality
analytics services
within neurodiverse workforce,

and with big data, I guess,
driving a lot of what we do,

I truly believe that
neurodiverse people will be

uniquely placed to
interpret this complexity

at speed and with such a
high degree of accuracy.

We are really excited to
see the social benefits
and the business outcomes
that this extended inclusion can bring.
- Absolutely, it's really amazing

that Ventia is actually
utilizing big data for this, too.
So Karen, to round up this interview,

are you able to share
any future technologies

that you're excited about
that will actually help
enhance your presence in the Cloud

and also your customer
experience with NTO?
- Yeah, sure.

Whether it's, lots of technologies
we're already trialing,

and we're working closely
with technology partners

to demonstrate key
benefits to our business
and to our clients.

And we're looking to
productionize a number
of these pilots so we can deliver benefits
on scale across our large enterprise.
So 5G and edge computing,
this enables us to connect people quickly
and analyze large amounts of data on site.

This is really critical for
us given the speed at which
we mobilize new projects,
but also the locations we may be in

and the amount of rich
asset data that we process.

Robotics in our AI,
they're already enabling us
to automate high volume processes
and to automatically make decisions
and recommendations based on algorithms
and continued learning.

We've got so much more
planned in this area.

And finally, augmented
reality and digital twins.

These enable us to
visualize our client assets
and to run scenarios

to identify the best productive
maintenance routines.
This is a real game changer
in improving asset management decisions,
extending the life of assets,
and reducing the cost of maintenance.

So some really exciting
technologies coming to the fore

that we are certainly
embracing and look forward

to delivering benefits from
over the next 12, 24 months.

- Karen, thank you so much
for coming on the show today.

The partnership between Ventia
and Amazon is really amazing.

If anyone has any questions
for Karen or about Ventia,

please pop them in the
comment section below
and we'll get back to you.
Thank you so much.
- Thanks, Aley.
